snippet: The Internet registration company sold stock at $20 a share, raising $440 million and putting its market value at just more than $3 billion.
abstract: GoDaddy raises $440 million after pricing initial public offering at $20 per share, exceeding expected price of $17 to $19 per share; sale vlaues company at $3 billion ahead of first day of trading on New York Stock Exchange; also reflects successful transition from early days in which it was known merely as Internet registration company with risque advertising.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. de la MERCED

lead_paragraph: The Internet registration company sold stock at $20 a share, raising $440 million and putting its market value at just more than $3 billion.

headline.main: GoDaddy Said to Price I.P.O. Above Expected Range
headline.print_headline: GoDaddy Set for Trading After Raising $440 Million
